title: For Sale/Trade:  1
For Sale:  Karen Klein fails to do job, gets rich. Sgt. 1st Class Taylor does job, gets screwed. We are truly a nation of idiots …
postcontent:
http://hadafewbeers.com/2012/06/25/karen-klein-fails-to-do-job-gets-rich-sgt-1st-class-taylor-does-job-gets-screwed-we-are-truely-a-nation-of-idiots/

Karen Klein is rich and we’re idiots.

This is going to be a two-part update.  Not two part as in I post one now and the other whenever I feel like it but rather a two part in that the first portion will be about me wondering what the fuck is wrong with America and the second part will be about me wondering what the fuck is wrong with America.

Look it’s about two different people okay.

Karen Klein, chances are by now you’ve seen the video and read about America’s outpouring of support for the grandmother who was viciously verbally assaulted by, wait for it, 12-year-olds.   Some reports now put donations at over half a million dollars because ‘grandma’ didn’t do her fucking job.

That’s right, it was her job to control the 30 or so 12-year-olds.  She failed and you all collectively said, “OH MY GOD THAT’S SO SAD!” and then gave her $20 a piece.     You’re pathetic (assuming you gave her a dime that is) and she’s pathetic.

Look, I don’t have kids so if you want to close the browser and yell out “well he just doesn’t know’ now that’s fine.  That aside I can easily think of three VERY simple things that would’ve resolved the situation quickly.

1: Kids listen up, ONE more word and this bus goes back to the school where I’ll have the principal call each and every one of your parents.

2:  Hold up your own phone (don’t have one Grams?  That was kind of dumb) and announce “this is all being recorded, unless this behavior stops right now I’m turning it over to (insert authority figure here).

3: Sucker punch the next 12-year-old that opens his or her mouth.  Yeah, yeah that’s bad but I’d have contributed to her defense fund then because that would have been HYSTERICAL!

What fun and ham fisted that was but the point is 12-year-olds are idiots, they are.  Have you listened to Justin Bieber, resolved, 12-year-olds are fucking retarded.  If you can’t outsmart one of them (even after having raised your own hoard) then what the fuck are you doing on that bus?

You baby boomers make me sick.  Would your parents have put up with that shit?  Hell no they were the greatest generation, more concerned with killing Nazis and cranking the bombing making technology up to 11.

We collectively make me sick, instead of asking ourselves how a grown woman let that happen (they’re fucking 12 remember) we opened our hearts and wallets cause ‘those kids were mean.”  There are also reports of the kids and their parents being harassed, fight bullying with bullying I guess.

And what does Karen plan to do with her half a million (besides take ‘the vacation of a lifetime’ for fuck’s sake)?  She plans to keep doing the job she absolutely sucks at.

Sgt. 1st Class Taylor is poor, we’re still idiots.

Now I’d like to turn your attention to Sgt. 1st Class Walter Taylor, who had to make a life or death decision in literal seconds.   While on patrol in Afghanistan, after his unit (a unit that was designed to find IEDs) encountered the worst road-side bomb of their tour, came under small-arms fire.   During the ensuing fire fight a black sedan drove into the battle, something that is unheard of for a civilian vehicle.    Couple that with the fact that his unit has just been briefed about the possibilities of suicide vehicle borne bombs and what happen next barely registers on my radar above the level of “unfortunate but understandable”.

After the gunfight, while following a wire used to detonate the bomb (a wire which seemed to lead up to the black sedan) Taylor came within 10 meters of the vehicle when a figure leapt from the rear passenger door and moved toward the trunk of the vehicle.    Taylor did what you or I or anyone else would do in that situation, he fired his weapon but subsequently discovered he’d killed an innocent person.

So of course Taylor faces charges of negligent homicide and dereliction of duty under the uniform code of military justice because … well I don’t know the because here, I just know it’s the reality.

I’ve sat though a lot of court marshals probably 20 or so.  Ninety-nine percent of the time the accused on the stand is guilty as sin. This, in my opinion, wasn’t one of them.   His stellar career, really it is a stellar career, aside what did the Army want this platoon sergeant to do, die to prove a point?   Had he had the time to logically think it through, say space aliens paused everyone but him, the choice was kill the civilian or let myself and my platoon members (there were three others with him) die.

When a platoon deploys to a war zone, and I know this as fact, they become family.   More than family in some ways, the bond runs deeper than family, family isn’t facing death every day, every minute, every second.  His platoon was in, what few would argue, the worst stretch of road in Afghanistan with orders to find all the road-side bombs and Oh, by the way, we now believe there are now suicide vehicle bombs as well so umm, good luck out there.

I’ll take she’s dies for $1,000 Alex and I’ll need that money because a civilian attorney is expensive.

Here’s the point, he hired a civilian lawyer rather than run the risk of being assigned a military one that passed the bar last night and has argued two cases.  Not a dumb move by anyone’s standard.

So here’s where I ask you all to do, go to this site and donate $20, or $50 or even $100, whatever you can do.   I did it, you’ll notice they’re woefully short of their humble $35,000 goal (having raised a whopping $1,180 as of this blog post) yet Karen, dear Karen gets the vacation of her dreams and half a million.

Did I mention that just a few short weeks later Taylor was hit in the face by RPG shrapnel?  He’s, and I’ve met him, disfigured and blind in one eye.  Yeah he’s got that going for him too.

Finally, look I love it when you all share this blog on FB or retweet it … I absolutely love it.  It tickles my ‘narcissistic’ button like nothing else can.  But this time I’m asking, begging, cut the part about Karen if you feel the need but repost this.   Taylor deserves half a million but needs $35,000.

http://www.indiegogo.com/support-sfc-taylor?c=comments&a=779530
Donate however much you can. If you have no money to give then all I ask is that you PASS THIS ON IN ANYWAY SHAPE OR FORM. Be it Facebook, Twitter, e-mail, etc. etc. We need to support our troops. This young man had to made a split second decision in a warzone where even the most intensely trained would have trouble.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Chicago residents
postcontent:
First I'd like to say thanks to all of the reasonable people who are sticking up for Chicago firearms owners.

Second, to the guy who spoke with police:  you are wrong, the police who told you that were wrong.  It shouldn't be surprising to you or anyone that Chicago police are notoriously ignorant of firearm laws.  I still meet cops who think its still completely illegal to own firearms in Chicago.  If your theory was true it would be the responsibility of every gun store that ever sold a gun to a Chicago resident to make sure they follow local ordinances...  I promise you it's not.  It is the responsibility of the buyer to comply with local laws that affect them.  That is why a chicago resident can go into any gun shop and buy and legally buy an ar-15, because the law only applies in COOK county.  This is why many gun ranges allow you to rent a locker to store firearms they own that may not be legal to possess within cook county.

title: For Trade:  WTT Smith and Wesson 411 .40 w/extras
location: Cleburne/Ft Worth Area, Texas, United States
postcontent:
I have here a Smith and Wesson 411. It is a metal framed gun. It has a left sided thumb safety. When you insert a loaded magazine and rack the slide to chamber a round, the hammer will be in the de-cocked position. The thumb safety's engagement blocks the firing pin and fully disconnects the trigger from the firing mechanism. Disengaging the thumb safety makes the gun ready to fire double action, and each shot after the hammer will be automatically cocked by virtue of the slide's rearward travel during the previous shot, or you can (after disengaging the thumb safety) cock the hammer and have a single action first shot. The gun also has a magazine disconnect, so if the magazine is out, it WILL NOT FIRE. I am currently using this gun at work as a duty weapon. I just had it cleaned by a gunsmith last week. It comes with the follwing:

1 FOBUS Paddle Holster

3 Factory 11 round magazines

1 Hogue rubber grip

I have ammo to trade with it if I trade for a different caliber handgun, I already have a 9mm so I am looking to stay with .40 or move up to .45, but will consider all trades of any caliber. The ammo I have to trade are these:

1 20 Round box of Hornady CRITICAL DEFENSE loaded with patented FTX bullet

1 20 Round box of Hornady ZOMBIE MAX rounds ( EXACT same round as the CRITICAL DEFENSE WITH FTX BULLET) just the ZOMBIE name and green tip instead of red. 

1 50 Round box of FEDERAL Classic Jacketed Hollowpoint Rounds.

I also have some .22LR ammo i can throw in. Offer me something and we'll make a deal.

Things I am interested in are as following:

title: For Sale/Trade:  WWII SPANISH AIRFORCE MAUSER RIFLE IN EXCELLENT CONDITION!
postcontent:
FOR SALE OR TRADE
Very nice 1943 / 1944 Spanish Airforce Mauser rifle in caliber 8mm Mauser. Very nice collectable and shootable condition. Great Spanish Airforce crest on receiver, no importers markings, all matching except for bolt (these were frequently changed in the armory when rifles were serviced or refurbished). No splits or cracks in wood, just some minor handling and storage dings. About 80% to 90% original arsenal finish, bright bore, mechanically excellent. Includes bayonet that fits perfectly, but not original to this rifle. Still, looks great for display. Missing cleaning rod, but any Mauser cleaning rod will work as replacement for display. Shoots great and includes 74 rounds of surplus ammunition. Ammo is sure fire good ammo, but corrosive like most military ammo, so clean the rifle after you use it. A great addition to any collection, and ready to take to the range or you're next hunting trip! $250. or will consider trade for either quality .22 pistol or 9mm compact pistol or ?

 Walther PPS is short recoil operated, locked breech pistol that uses modified Browning type locking with tilting barrel. Frame of the gun is made from impact resistant polymer. Trigger is of double action only type, striker fired, with pre-cocked striker system, similar to QA system used in Walther P99 pistols. This system requires a manual recocking (by partial slide retraction) in the case of misfire. Gun is fitted with automated trigger safety and firing pin block; additional "storage type" safety is provided by removable backstrap of the grip; once backstrap is removed, the firing pin is automatically decocked and gun is blocked until the backstrap is reinstalled. This patented system is called QuickSafe by Walther. Sights are low profile, with rear sight adjustable for windage.

The P30 is one of the most advanced police pistols of all time. During it's development the most important requirements were flexibility, functionality and safety. Ergonomics of the grip have been improved by interchangeable backstraps and side panel inserts. In combination with the ambidextrous operating controls, this pistol can be individually adapted to almost any user. The P30L (for Long), has a slide and barrel that measure approximately a half-inch longer in length. Otherwise the P30L is essentially identical to the P30. No compromises have been made regarding safety. The P30L V3 has a traditional double action/single action trigger system with a decocking button at the rear of the slide and a firing pin block safety that eliminate the need for a manual safety. Its advanced loaded chamber indicator, which is easily seen and felt, positively indicates a loaded chamber. Another feature is the SuperLuminova 3-dot sights with non-tritium luminous dots, allowing an exact target acquisition even under poor lighting conditions.

The barrel and the frame show Winchester proof marks. The barrel assembly and frame are stamped with the serial number. The lower tang is marked “EW”.

Choke: Full

Sights / Optics: This shotgun is mounted with a full length rib and two silver beads.

Stock Configuration & Condition: The stocks are highly figured, oil finished and checkered wood. The checkering is worn and the wood shows scattered handling and storage marks. The stocks rate in about Fine overall condition.

Type of Finish: Blue

Finish Originality: Factory Original

Bore Condition: The bore is almost mirror bright, though just a bit fouled. There is no pitting.

Overall Condition: This shotgun retains about 85% of its metal finish. The balance of the finish shows thinning at the edges, though primarily at the muzzle and frame. The bare metal here has begun to freckle just a bit. The finish is absolutely original, with a just starting drift to light patina at areas of thinning. The magazine tube shows wear from operation. The Screw heads are a bit worn, but serviceable. The markings are clear. Overall, this shotgun rates in about Very Good - Fine condition. 
No ffl

title: For Sale/Trade:  ///MILLED Norinco Hunter///
postcontent:
Very nice example of the rare & never again imported Norinco 'Hunter'.
 These are....er; were made by the "Legend"ary Polytech '386' Arsenal, and were Imported in the early 90's. 
 It is totally Original, with a Chrome Bolt/ Chrome Lined 20" Barrel / & the flip-up Short Range/Long Range sights (which I find quicker & easier to use than the standard military AK sights)/ ALL Chinese AK Parts...Nothing replaced for 992r compliance (or needs to be in this configuration, unless you'd like to build a Galil Clone or something!)/ And of course a very solid Milled Receiver!

 I consider these to be a 'Sleeper' AK variant, as many people are looking for a 'Real AK' with 'Evil Features'....If you think a WASR-10 is a real AK- OK? But if you want Pure Polytech-Knowledgey; something  any real AK collector can appreciate, that's your choice too. 
As far as I can tell, ya can't get it wrong with any ALL FACTORY Imported AK.
Which means original older guns....Of course there are a lot of fine AK builders out there- and if you are one: Then ya know that. And also, that quality originals are getting scarce.

 The Norinco 'Hunter'- while primarily designed for hunting (Big Surprise!), still takes any regular Hi-Cap AK Mag/Drums and makes a good medium-range range gun,  & can still handle all of your Heavy Duty Plinking needs.
 So if you're a Hunter, and have been hunting for an AK, (with all the 'Evil', but none of it's features)- Perhaps you've been hunting for a Norinco 'Hunter'.

 I'd really prefer to deal locally (near OKC): And am interested in trading for an STI Spartan 1911, or better yet, a Kel-Tec PLR-16.....Or silver, or maybe an old S&W Revolver. Trades can be 'adjusted' accordingly.
 This rifle is in really great condition, & doesn't have any Bubbanizations. Comes with one 30 rnd. mag, at least.

title: For Sale:  1954 M38A1 Willys Army jeep
postcontent:
I have a complete M38A1 Willys Army jeep from 1954, it is complete! With the original data plates and all the parts are there including top bows and seats, Has new military canvas driver seat as well as the rear bottom seat cushion. I can finish the cnavas job on the other seats if you so desire it. I have spent the better part of 16 months bringing this old Army veteran jeep back to its military glory. It has all the hard to find accessories and attachments. All Five tires are original military tires, as are the rims. I just installed a rebuilt T-90 transmission this year, a complete new old stock exhaust system. This jeep needs some paint and your markings and you are ready for parades, vfw functions or just to jeep around with. I have a box of extra parts that will come with it. Currently the jeep is in 12 volt, I have all the parts to convert over to a complete dual battery 24 volt system. This is the most complete M38A1 offered. Has all the original lifting shackles and front bumper that has not been molested or cut. New ties rods installed, new steering bellcrank, two new front brake cylinders. The fuel tank is original and has already been gone through and restored so you will not have to worry about a fuel tank leaking. Comes with two fuel cans (5 gallon military one is dated 1977 the other is new old stock from 1955) Also comes with two gallons of the correct semi-gloss paint you will need to finish the restoration. If you have any questions call me at 580 six four seven 00 four five. She stops drives and runs. I have put alot of work into this old work horse. But the wife says I can only have one jeep. So now is your chance! 
I also have two original manuals for this jeep that come with it as well. 
If you are a korean war veteran or veteran period, with proof, I will take $500 off the asking price. And last but not least, I will deliver this jeep to within 100 miles of zip code (73543/Geronimo, OK) Call or email or text. Thanks for your time.

title: For Sale:  PTR-91 GI model, w/ Millet DMS-1 and PEPR scope mount + 9 magazines
postcontent:
F/S a PTR-91 GI in like new condition. The GI model is designed with slightly looser tolerances to accommodate all the crappy .308/762x51mm you get for cheap or steal from the range. The SN on this rifle is well outside the range of "defects" that PTR let out (those rifles are SNs 0001-0250), and when headspaced at the store it was at .333mm. After firing and cleaned it was at .25mm, well within acceptable boundaries. The rollers are those that all PTRs come with, and oversized rollers WILL NOT be necessary until your round count is at least in the 5000s, if that.

I've fired 120 rounds of Lake City M80 reloads (VERY clean-shooting), 40+ rounds of Silver Bear, and 40 rounds of Wolf. Never any FTF, FTE, malfunctions, etc. Shoots reasonably accurate--especially as advertised. I think my best was actually from the Silver Bear (2 inch group at a hundred yards from a bench)

I have 9 20rd magazines total for it, 1 PTR-91 Inc mag, and 8 West German surplus aluminum mags that have been cleaned of cosmoline and have no rust on the followers. 

The DMS-1/mount is optional, it's a damn good 1-4x scope and I could use it on any of my other guns. If you want it without the optic then I'll bring it down to 950.

I will accept cash or discrete PayPal. Obviously, must have proof of existence on this planet and be willing to sign a receipt. 

Will trade for: Imbel or DSA FAL build--not preferential to model. No Imbels on an Enterprise receiver though, thanks. Or, if you have an Arsenal-assembled AK, I'd look into it, as I'm sitting on WAY too much 5.45mm at the moment.

postcontent:
3 AVAILABLE   FREE SHIPPING

Here I have several Aimpoint CompM4 Scopes for sale.
All come in box with matching serial numbers.
Screws, Rail, Clamp and everything shown in pictures is included.

AIMPOINT COMPM4S WITH QRP2 MNT & ARD 

This design, designated as the CompM4s, features a low-mounted battery compartment giving the sight a lower overall profile, and placing the switch and battery compartment in a more protected position while preserving all of the outstanding features of the standard CompM4 sight. 

The electronic components in the CompM4 include Aimpoint’s Super ACET diode circuitry, allowing the sight to run constantly for up to 8 years on a single AA battery. All CompM4 sights feature an internal voltage regulator that allows the sights to operate on any AA size battery available worldwide. 

These sights also feature a 2 minute-of-angle (MOA) dot size, making them perfectly suited for use with Aimpoint’s 3XMagnifier and Concealed Engagement Unit (CEU). 

The CompM4 is optimized for use with all generations of night vision devices, and features an extremely rugged and easy to use 16-position manual switch with 7 night vision compatible settings and 9 daylight settings. The CompM4 sight body is designed to protect the optical and electronic components inside against hard use, and keeps the sight waterproof to 45 meters (150 feet). 

Features:
• Compatible with every generation of Night Vision Devices (NVD) 
• Super ACET technology allows up to 80,000 hours (over 8 years) of daytime operation on one AA battery 
• Internal voltage regulator allows the CompM4 to be used with any AA size battery. 
• Seven night vision compatible settings and 9 daylight settings
• QRP2 mount has twice the clamping force of the original QRP, and the mounting knob is wider and shorter to improve operation, and lessen the chance of becoming snagged on other gear. 
• Mount base is “keyed” into to the body of the sight to absorb recoil. 
• Mount base screws directly into the sight – no separate sight ring is required. 
• 500,000 hours of use on NVD setting 
• 2 MOA dot for close combat and long distance engagement
• Matches perfectly with Aimpoint 3XMag, (magnifier module). 
• Unequalled light transmission. 
• Front lens opening is threaded for addition of killFlash anti-reflective device. 
• Submersible to 150 feet (45 meters) 
• Vertical spacer included
• Standardized as the US Army’s new M68CCO 
• Improved adjustment caps are easier to remove, and are protected against impact. 
• Can be used with a carry handle adaptor 

SPECIFICATIONS 
•Optical: System Passive Red Dot Collimator Reflex Sight 
•Magnification: 1X 
•Eye relief: Unlimited 
•Reticle, size: 2 MOA 
•Optical coating: Anti Reflex coating all surfaces. Multi-layer coating for reflection of Pass coating for NVD compatibility 
•Battery Type: AA 
•Battery Life: Typical** 80 000 hours for good quality battery 
•Switch: dot brightness 16 positions, 7 NVD, 9 daylight, of which 1 Extra bright 
•Housing Material: Extruded high strength aluminium 
•Surface finish: Hard anodized, matte, black 
•Lens covers: Rubber, matte, black 
•Adjustment: 1 click = 16 mm at 100 meters = 1/2" at 80 yds 
•Length: 120 mm (4.7") 
•Width/height: 53x60 mm (2.1"x2.4") sight only - 72x72 mm (2.8"x2.8") including mount 
•Weight: 335 g (11.8 oz) with integrated mount

title: For Sale/Trade:  Beauty little .32 Cal. Thompson Center Cherokee Muzzleloader
postcontent:
I have a .32 Cal. Thompson Center Cherokee muzzleloader that I bought in 1988 time frame.  I squirrel hunted with it a few times that fall and it's been in a cabinet since then. I was in an accident in 1989 leaving me a paraplegic, so I got into crossbows after that.  I bought it mainly because it was just a clone to the .50 Cal I was shooting, so easy to hold and honestly just a cool looking little muzzleloader.  I have put many .50 Cal kits together and this is not a kit.  I did break the wooden ram rod when hunting, so I bought a fiberglass ram rod that works so much better.
I have seen a few internet threads where collectors like this gun. It is in good condition. It has a small scratch on the butt plate. However, it's in fine shape other than that.
I will get some photos of it on this post within the next 36 hrs. Please email questions.

title: For Sale:  Bushmaster XM15-E2S A2 or A3 Style
postcontent:
Bushmaster 16” Bbl. Carbines offer compact size, balanced swing weight, and great accuracy. With Forged Aluminum Receivers, Six Position Telestocks, and Carbine Length Handguards, these versatile carbines are standard issue for many Law Enforcement and Military units.

16” Heavy Profile ChromeMoly Vanadium Steel Barrel - Chrome lined in both Bore and Chamber for easy chambering, long life and quick clean-up – Manganese Phosphate finished to protect against corrosion or rust. Muzzle is threaded and fitted with an A2 “Birdcage” Flash Suppressor.

Dual Aperture Rear Sights on A2 models have 1 M.o.A. elevation adjustments and ½ M.o.A. windage adjustments with a 300-800 meter range. The A3 Type Carbines (Removable Carry Handle included) have ½ M.o.A. adjustments for both elevation and windage with a 300-600 meter range. The A3 Upper has a Picatinny rail for the attachment of sights, scopes, or night vision optics. A2 Front Post Type Sights are elevation adjustable

Upper and Lower Receivers are machined from 7075 T6 aircraft aluminum and Hard Anodize finished to a non-reflective matte black. Uppers feature an interior dry film lube coating for smooth operation.

Six Position Telescoping Stocks are fitted - overall carbine length with stock collapsed is 4“ shorter for easy handling in tight confines.
